intro: Seseli mazzocchii-alamannii, commonly known as the Alamanii seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and compound umbel flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional herbal medicine. It thrives in rocky or disturbed soils and is native to parts of Europe and western Asia. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
